title: The Modern Traveller
description: The Modern traveller is Hilaire Belloc's satirical depiction of a three-man trip to Africa, first published when Belloc was a vivid twenty-eight years of age and of high-spirit. He had already publicly presented his sequence of comic and cautionary tales for children. Like most of these tales, The Modern Traveller bears memorable, pertinent illustrations by his friend, Basil Blackwood.
